types.description: Persists the last input packet's data it receives to storage, also repeating that packet on output port. If the value is unchanged, then the packet is not repeated, this allows the use of persistence in feedback loops with setters of data to be persisted. Note that upon a new connection on the unique output port, if a previous stored packet is found, it will already be sent.
types.name: persistence/boolean

members.description: Name to persist a boolean packet. If 'storage' is 'fs', name can be a fully fledged path to the file where the value will be stored.
members.name: name

members.description: Storage where data will be persisted. It can be of the following: fs, efivars
members.name: storage

members.description: Default value for this node, when there's no previous value persisted
members.name: default_value

in_ports.description: A boolean packet to persist (and repeat on output)
in_ports.name: IN

in_ports.description: Reset persist value to its default and send to output the new value
in_ports.name: RESET

out_ports.description: A boolean packet with the persisted value of the node
out_ports.name: OUT

out_ports.name: OUT

members.name: storage

members.description: Default value for this node, when there's no previous value persisted
members.name: default_value

members.description: Default range for this node, when there's no previous value persisted
members.name: default_value_spec

members.description: Store only drange val, discarding min, max and step values
members.name: store_only_val

in_ports.description: An float packet to persist (and repeat on output)
in_ports.name: IN

in_ports.description: Reset persist value to its default and send to output the new value
in_ports.name: RESET

out_ports.description: A float packet with the persisted value of the node
out_ports.name: OUT
